sense.name: move along a circular course
sense.commentary: NOTE: compare carefully to sense 2; in this sense, there is actual movement of a theme along a path
sense.examples: As she rounded a corner she could see the same man. I could see the new pickup she was driving as she rounded a curve on the gravel road. I rounded the bend on the Crabtree Creek greenway, perhaps going a tad over the posted speed limit.

sense.name: have a circular path
sense.commentary: NOTE: compare carefully to sense 1; in this sense, the 'rounding' describes the shape and location of the path, not actual movement
sense.examples: The view as the road rounded was breathtaking. The path rounded the hill and came to a fork. Just where the river rounded the hill the sun caught it.

sense.name: make into or become a smooth, circular shape
sense.examples: They rounded off the edges with a sander. Picasso in 1905 rounded out the sharp faces of his Blue period figures. She held the sculpture and felt how the sides rounded, the edges inflected. We took a standard APEX scull blade and rounded the edges to approximate a delta shape. Regular meals had softened the chiseled bones in her face and rounded out the sharp angles of her body.

sense.name: bring into a refined state
sense.examples: Tahini rounded out the sharp nearly discordant edges marrying the favors into a lovely whole. The passage to India has rounded out the sharp corners for the Western palate. Despite the aforementioned flaws rounded off by amateurish editing, the game is brainless fun.

sense.name: attack verbally
sense.examples: She rounded on the new boy and said that he had no idea what he was talking about. He rounded on her with the full force of those penetrating eyes. Even though her pack of attack dogs rounded on me, I kept beating them off.

sense.name: estimate
sense.commentary: Includes: ROUND DOWN, ROUND OFF, ROUND OUT, ROUND UP
sense.examples: Please round your answer to three decimals. When entering time on your time sheet, round to the nearest quarter-hour.

sense.name: complete, fill out
sense.examples: The day is rounded off with the breaking of the fast through a special dinner.

sense.name: seek out and bring together
sense.examples: I've rounded up some simple tips and tutorials for the conference.. Kay has rounded up a bunch of great articles on our tax system. The police rounded up all the suspects.

sense.name: pronounce with rounded lips
sense.examples: Vaz rounded his vowels to make himself sound wronged. He rounded his vowels and the resulting 'educated' accent made him sound British.
